data.event: The municipality has a population of 1,032 (30 June 2015) and covers an area of 184.12 square kilometres (71.09 sq mi) of which 76.06 km2 (29.37 sq mi) is water.
It was first mentioned in 1388 in the contract of Queen Margaret I, where a large portion of the inheritance of Bo Jonsson Grip was given to her.

event.title: kept his deposed brother Eric XIV in captivity in the castle in the Fall of 1571

data.event: King John III kept his deposed brother Eric XIV in captivity in the castle in the Fall of 1571.
Today, it is partially restored and a popular tourist attraction.

event.title: was opened to the public in 2001

data.event: The whole castle was opened to the public in 2001.
